name: Kai's bird game, by Kai
description:
Kai's bird game, by Kai was a wacky little mini-game featuring 2 birds and was created by Seth from Cedar (Unfortunately, Kai didn't actually create the bird game). One bird you would control with your mouse, and the other bird would chase you. The enemy bird starts off being slow, but its speed raises every few seconds, making it harder and harder as you go on. Obviously, if the bird did manage to catch up to you, you would basically die, and text appearing on the screen would say "your sh*t score was [your score]" this sounds like a very simple game concept, which it is. However, Kai's Bird Game, by Kai: Unity edition expands on that concept, adding obstacles that you and the enemy bird could hit, and making it more of a fun and wacky experience!

Controls & Game play

The controls are pretty simple, move your mouse to control where the bird goes. The enemy bird will start off slow, but its speed will increase more and more slowly. This is identical to the classic Kai's Bird Game, by Kai, but there's one more thing I added. Obstacles! Currently, their are only 2 obstacles in the game, Bombs, and Acid rain. For each wave, their is a chance of 2, 3, or 5 bombs dropping. They're pretty easy to avoid, and you can make the enemy bird touch them to lower its speed. However, if you touch a bomb, the enemy's speed will rise, so watch out for that! The second one is Acid rain, this one's a bit harder to avoid because they're moving obstacles. But similarly to bombs, you can make the enemy touch a rain droplet to lower the speed of it, or vise versa.
